exercise.p: Determine the value of the expression 3p + 5q when p = -2 and q = -1. Show the calculation and write your result as an if-then statement.

aside.p: The most common errors on these problems tend to be the simple arithmetic steps. Take your time and be careful!

exercise.p: Substitute b = 3a - 5 into the expression 2b + 3 and simplify the result. Use a complete presentation.

aside.p: Be aware of this error so that you can avoid making it yourself!

exercise.p: Determine the value of the expression 4a - 3b when a = -3 and b = 4. Show the calculation and write your result as an if-then statement.
Substitute n = -2m + 1 into the expression -n + 2 and simplify the result. Use a complete presentation.
Substitute y = 2x - 3 into the expression 2x + 3y and simplify the result. Use a complete presentation.
Determine the value of the expression x - y^2 when x = 2 and y = -3. Show the calculation and write your result as an if-then statement.
Solve the equation -3a + 4b - 7 = 5 for when b = -2. Use a complete presentation.
Substitute s = -2t + 1 into the equation 2s + 1 = 4 and solve for the variable. Use a complete presentation.
Solve the equation 3m - 2n - 7 = 5 for when m = 4n - 3. Use a complete presentation.
Substitute x = 3 into the expression x^2 - 6x + 9 and simplify the result. Use a complete presentation.

aside.p: The value of x must be the same for the entire expression. We do not want x to take two different values at the same time.

exercise.p: Substitute n = -2m - 3 into the expression -3m - 2n + 5 and simplify the result. Use a complete presentation.
Solve the equation -2a + 3b - 7 = b for when b = -a + 2. Use a complete presentation.
